content:
MediaElement Class

In this Article

Represents a control that contains audio and/or video.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.NeverLocalize)]
public class MediaElement : System.Windows.FrameworkElement, System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Visual
  • UIElement
  • System.Windows.FrameworkElement
  • MediaElement

Remarks

When distributing media with your application, you cannot use a media file as a project resource. In your project file, you must instead set the media type to Content and set CopyToOutputDirectory to PreserveNewest or Always.

MediaElement can be used in two different modes, depending on what is driving the control: independent mode or clock mode. When used in the independent mode, the MediaElement is analogous to an image, and Source URI can be directly specified. In clock mode, the MediaElement can be thought of as a target for an animation, and thus it will have corresponding Timeline and Clock entries in the timing tree. For more information on media modes, see the Multimedia Overview.

For an example of controlling a MediaElement in independent mode, see How to: Control a MediaElement (Play, Pause, Stop, Volume, and Speed).

Until the MediaOpened event has been raised, the ActualWidth and ActualHeight of the control will report as zero as the media content is used to determine the final size and location of the control. For audio only content, these properties will always be zero.

For a fixed size control, the Width and/or Height properties can be set. However, to preserve the media's aspect ratio, set the Width or Height properties but not both.

Properties summary

Balance

Gets or sets a ratio of volume across speakers.
BufferingProgress

Gets a value that indicates the percentage of buffering progress made.
CanPause

Gets a value indicating whether the media can be paused.
Clock

Gets or sets the clock associated with the MediaTimeline that controls media playback.
DownloadProgress

Gets a percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server.
HasAudio

Gets a value indicating whether the media has audio.
HasVideo

Gets a value indicating whether the media has video.
IsBuffering

Get a value indicating whether the media is buffering.
IsMuted

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the audio is muted.
LoadedBehavior

Gets or sets the load behavior MediaState for the media.
NaturalDuration

Gets the natural duration of the media.
NaturalVideoHeight

Gets the height of the video associated with the media.
NaturalVideoWidth

Gets the width of the video associated with the media.
Position

Gets or sets the current position of progress through the media's playback time.
ScrubbingEnabled

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the MediaElement will update frames for seek operations while paused.
Source

Gets or sets a media source on the MediaElement.
SpeedRatio

Gets or sets the speed ratio of the media.
Stretch

Gets or sets a Stretch value that describes how a MediaElement fills the destination rectangle.
StretchDirection

Gets or sets a value that determines the restrictions on scaling that are applied to the image.
UnloadedBehavior

Gets or sets the unload behavior MediaState for the media.
Volume

Gets or sets the media's volume.

Methods summary

ArrangeOverride(Size)

Arranges and sizes a MediaElement control.
Close()

Closes the media.
MeasureOverride(Size)

Updates the stem.Windows.UIElement.DesiredSize* of the MediaElement. This method is called by a parent UIElement. This is the first pass of layout.
OnCreateAutomationPeer()

Creates and returns an AutomationPeer object for this MediaElement.
OnRender(DrawingContext)

Draws the content of a DrawingContext object during the render pass of a MediaElement control.
Pause()

Pauses media at the current position.
Play()

Plays media from the current position.
Stop()

Stops and resets media to be played from the beginning.

Events summary

BufferingEnded

Occurs when media buffering has ended.
BufferingStarted

Occurs when media buffering has begun.
MediaEnded

Occurs when the media has ended.
MediaFailed

Occurs when an error is encountered.
MediaOpened

Occurs when media loading has finished.
ScriptCommand

Occurs when a script command is encountered in the media.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IUriContext.BaseUri

This type or member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

  • VolumeProperty

    Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Volume* dependency property.

    public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty VolumeProperty;

Properties

  • Balance

    Gets or sets a ratio of volume across speakers.

    public double Balance { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The ratio of volume across speakers in the range between -1 and 1. The default is 0.

    Remarks

    A value of -1 represents 100% of the left side speakers and 1 represents 100% of the right side speakers.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field BalanceProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • BufferingProgress

    Gets a value that indicates the percentage of buffering progress made.

    public double BufferingProgress { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The percentage of buffering completed for streaming content. The value ranges from 0 to 1.

  • CanPause

    Gets a value indicating whether the media can be paused.

    public bool CanPause { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the media can be paused; otherwise, false.

  • Clock

    Gets or sets the clock associated with the MediaTimeline that controls media playback.

    public System.Windows.Media.MediaClock Clock { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MediaClock

      A clock associated with the MediaTimeline that controls media playback. The default value is null.

    Remarks

    Setting this property puts the media element into a mode in which it utilizes the timing engine. Any media that was previously playing is stopped and the uniform resource identifier (URI) associated with the new clock is opened.

  • DownloadProgress

    Gets a percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server.

    public double DownloadProgress { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      A percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server. The value ranges from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.

  • HasAudio

    Gets a value indicating whether the media has audio.

    public bool HasAudio { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the media has audio; otherwise, false.

  • HasVideo

    Gets a value indicating whether the media has video.

    public bool HasVideo { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the media has video; otherwise, false.

  • IsBuffering

    Get a value indicating whether the media is buffering.

    public bool IsBuffering { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the media is buffering; otherwise, false.

  • IsMuted

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the audio is muted.

    public bool IsMuted { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if audio is muted; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field IsMutedProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • LoadedBehavior

    Gets or sets the load behavior MediaState for the media.

    public System.Windows.Controls.MediaState LoadedBehavior { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MediaState

      The load behavior MediaState set for the media. The default value is MediaState.

    Remarks

    LoadedBehavior must be set to MediaState in order to interactively control media with the Play, Pause, and Stop methods.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field LoadedBehaviorProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • NaturalDuration

    Gets the natural duration of the media.

    public System.Windows.Duration NaturalDuration { get; }

    Property Value

    • Duration

      The natural duration of the media.

    Remarks

    The value returned is independent of SpeedRatio.

    NaturalDuration is not accurate until the MediaOpened event has been raised.

  • NaturalVideoHeight

    Gets the height of the video associated with the media.

    public int NaturalVideoHeight { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The height of the video associated with the media. Audio files will return zero.

    Remarks

    NaturalVideoHeight is not accurate until the MediaOpened event has been raised.

  • NaturalVideoWidth

    Gets the width of the video associated with the media.

    public int NaturalVideoWidth { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The width of the video associated with the media.

    Remarks

    NaturalVideoWidth is not accurate until the MediaOpened event has been raised.

  • Position

    Gets or sets the current position of progress through the media's playback time.

    public TimeSpan Position { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The amount of time since the beginning of the media. The default is 00:00:00.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    Setting this property can enable you to jump to different points in playback (also known as seeking). Not all media types allow seek operations. The MediaFailed event will fire if the media source does not allow seeking.

    This property has no effect until after the MediaOpened event has occurred.

    This property can be set only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

  • ScrubbingEnabled

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the MediaElement will update frames for seek operations while paused.

    public bool ScrubbingEnabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if frames are updated while paused; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    When set to false, seeking to a specific location will only update the displayed frame if media is playing.

    Setting ScrubbingEnabled to true can incur some performance costs, especially when interactively controlling media playback.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ScrubbingEnabledProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • Source

    Gets or sets a media source on the MediaElement.

    public Uri Source { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      The URI that specifies the source of the element. The default is null.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    Setting the value of this property causes the media to play.

    This property can be set only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field SourceProperty
    Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure, AffectsRender
  • SpeedRatio

    Gets or sets the speed ratio of the media.

    public double SpeedRatio { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The speed ratio of the media. The valid range is between 0 (zero) and infinity. Values less than 1 yield slower than normal playback, and values greater than 1 yield faster than normal playback. Negative values are treated as 0. The default value is 1.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    This property can be set only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

    Audio playback may not occur unless the value of SpeedRatio is 1.

  • Stretch

    Gets or sets a Stretch value that describes how a MediaElement fills the destination rectangle.

    public System.Windows.Media.Stretch Stretch { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Stretch

      The stretch value for the rendered media. The default is Stretch.

    Remarks

    The following illustration demonstrates the different Stretch values.


    Different gradient spread methods

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field StretchProperty
    Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure

    Example

    The following example shows how to create a Viewbox and set the Stretch mode of content. 

    
// Create a Viewbox and add it to the Canvas
myViewbox = new Viewbox();
myViewbox.StretchDirection = StretchDirection.Both;
myViewbox.Stretch = Stretch.Fill;
myViewbox.MaxWidth = 400;
myViewbox.MaxHeight = 400;

    
// Create a Viewbox and add it to the Canvas
myViewbox = gcnew Viewbox();
myViewbox->StretchDirection = StretchDirection::Both;
myViewbox->Stretch = Stretch::Fill;
myViewbox->MaxWidth = 400;
myViewbox->MaxHeight = 400;

    
' Create a ViewBox and add it to the Canvas
Dim myViewbox As New Viewbox()
myViewbox.StretchDirection = StretchDirection.Both
myViewbox.Stretch = Stretch.Fill
myViewbox.MaxWidth = 400
myViewbox.MaxHeight = 400
  • StretchDirection

    Gets or sets a value that determines the restrictions on scaling that are applied to the image.

    public System.Windows.Controls.StretchDirection StretchDirection { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • StretchDirection

      The value that specifies the direction the element is stretched. The default is StretchDirection.

    Remarks

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field StretchDirectionProperty
    Metadata properties set to true AffectsMeasure

    Example

    This snippet ID stretchmediaelementexamplewholepage is used in multiple files: /VB/StretchMediaElementExample.xaml, /CSharp/StretchMediaElementExample.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).

    This snippet ID stretchmediaelementexamplewholepage is used in multiple files: /VB/StretchMediaElementExample.xaml, /CSharp/StretchMediaElementExample.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).
  • UnloadedBehavior

    Gets or sets the unload behavior MediaState for the media.

    public System.Windows.Controls.MediaState UnloadedBehavior { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MediaState

      The unload behavior MediaState for the media.

    Remarks

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field UnloadedBehaviorProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • Volume

    Gets or sets the media's volume.

    public double Volume { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The media's volume represented on a linear scale between 0 and 1. The default is 0.5.

    Remarks

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field VolumeProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

  • ArrangeOverride(Size)

    Arranges and sizes a MediaElement control.

    protected override System.Windows.Size ArrangeOverride (System.Windows.Size finalSize);

    Parameters

    • finalSize
      Size

      Size used to arrange the control.

    Returns

    • Size

      Size of the control.

  • Close()

    Closes the media.

    public void Close ();
  • MeasureOverride(Size)

    Updates the stem.Windows.UIElement.DesiredSize* of the MediaElement. This method is called by a parent UIElement. This is the first pass of layout.

    protected override System.Windows.Size MeasureOverride (System.Windows.Size availableSize);

    Parameters

    • availableSize
      Size

      The upper limit the element should not exceed.

    Returns

    • Size

      The desired size.

  • OnCreateAutomationPeer()

    Creates and returns an AutomationPeer object for this MediaElement.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer OnCreateAutomationPeer ();

    Returns

    • AutomationPeer

      An AutomationPeer for this MediaElement.

  • OnRender(DrawingContext)

    Draws the content of a DrawingContext object during the render pass of a MediaElement control.

    protected override void OnRender (System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext drawingContext);

    Parameters

    • drawingContext
      DrawingContext

      The DrawingContext to draw.

  • Pause()

    Pauses media at the current position.

    public void Pause ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    This method pauses the media if the media is currently running. The Play method can be used to resume.

    This method can be used only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

    This method has an effect only if the LoadedBehavior property is set to MediaState.

  • Play()

    Plays media from the current position.

    public void Play ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    This method will begin the media if it is not currently active or resume media if it is paused. This method has no effect if the media is currently running.

    This method can be used only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

    This method has an effect only if the LoadedBehavior property is set to MediaState.

  • Stop()

    Stops and resets media to be played from the beginning.

    public void Stop ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock* property is not null.

    Remarks

    This method can be used only when the Clock property is null. When the Clock property is non-null, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.

    This method has an effect only if the LoadedBehavior property is set to MediaState.

rawMetadata.title: MediaElement class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Represents a control that contains audio and/or video.
